ReportText: EXAM: XR CHEST 2 VIEWS CXR HISTORY: ^ADD HX: COUGH/FEVER X2D ^cough/fever. TECHNIQUE: Upright PA and lateral chest radiographs. COMPARISON: None. FINDINGS: Bilateral central peribronchial cuffing as well as some perihilar infiltrate. No peripheral infiltrate or consolidation. Normal cardiomediastinal silhouette. No pleural fluid or air. No acute bony abnormality. IMPRESSION: Findings are not specific but are seen most frequently with viral lower respiratory tract infection and/or asthma.
